Brooklyn, NY 2/2/2012 I needed a place to study. These days it seems like all I do is read article after article on tuberculosis. Sigh. FML.
I came here to finish up some work and to just relax a bit before going to yoga class. The place is very clean and sleek. Nice red chairs that look great against white tables and white walls.
I knew this coffee shop wasn't an American creation, so I went to their website and learnt that this is a chain in Israel. Aha! I was right!
It was extremely warm out so I opted for an iced coffee, which came to less than $3. Not too bad, as Starbucks would charge you an arm and a leg for burnt coffee.
I sat a communal table and happily drank my iced coffee and read my articles. It was a fun place to just unwind. A great spot to meet up with friends and just catch up over a cup of joe.

Bronx, NY 1/12/2012 1 Check-in Here Free WiFi, good coffee, and ample space = great study spot! Not exactly a quiet place, with the servers constantly announcing orders over a PA system, but if you can just tuck that into the background noise you're golden! It's got a buzzing atmosphere that isn't loud or overwhelming, and you can definitely still get lost in your own world in a book, doing work, etc. Upstairs seating is a little harder to find, but people are moving in and out constantly, so the hunt is never long.
My chai was too sweet--I ended up drinking some and adding milk twice. This wasn't actually a problem, though, because they serve their drinks so hot my chai was just the right temp after adding some milk! They have yummy looking soups and sandwiches, and give each person a small chocolate piece with each drink!
Will definitely be back to catch up with friends or on some good reading.

New York, NY 10/2/2011 This is the perfect spot to meet up with some friends if you all are going to be trickling at at different times. You order at the counter, take a seat in one of the many different seating options (bar stools, communal tables, patio seating upstairs, or indoor couch/lounge area upstairs)
The menu looks fantastic, though some items are a bit pricey. There are tons of options, from breakfast eggs or oatmeal to sandwich/soup/salad lunches. I did not order food, but my friend loved his $10 Caesar salad. I had an iced Chai latte, which was heavy on the latte part (a lot like spiced milk), but I enjoyed it.
They offer internet with purchase, so be sure to ask for an internet receipt if you want to enjoy wifi with your food or drink.
This is the most spacious location I have found for any cafe in my neighborhood, so it's advantageous when you need to just sit down for a while.

Manhattan, NY 2/13/2012 1 photo In a never ending search for the "perfect" study spot in the city, I decided to give Aroma a try. Just when I thought I'd found it - delicious foamy cappuccinos, lots of study space, natural light, free wifi - I realized that their "free wifi" didn't work. After reading yelp reviews AND asking the cashier before ordering, I turned on my computer and couldn't connect ... and was then met with shrugs by the staff who all told me that the Internet hadn't been working all morning (despite telling me otherwise when I ordered) / they'd been having problems the past few days. I completely understand internet woes, but why not tell me first?!? I spent a considerable amount of time restarting my computer / trying all other options per the recommendations of the only barista who seemed to care, but no luck. At this point, I had wasted an hour - and $5 for a small cappuccino - and didn't have any work to show for it. When I thanked the staff for their help in trying to fix my computer and said that I was incredibly disappointed in the experience, they didn't offer any incentive to return nor did they even apologize. Just more shrugs. Such a shame because otherwise I loved Aroma. But without internet, I have no reason to return.
.... but sadly still thinking about that cappuccino and the perfect ratio of espresso to cloud-like soy foam ...

New York, NY 9/7/2011 6 Check-ins Here Starbucks this place is not. In a way, that's good. Prices are certainly higher here, but you are getting better quality food and beverages too. Plus this place is super cute and uber-trendy. The music selection is awesome (I walked up to the counter listening to "Safety Dance" by Men W/o Hats).
But in a way it's bad. Don't come in here expecting to get free bandwidth. Sure, it keeps the "let's hang out all day and not buy a damn thing" element out. And I've said before, I'll gladly buy an overpriced cup of coffee for WiFi. And you get a login/password for an hour. I think that's fair.
I bought my mocha coffee...Wow, is that PURE CHOCOLATE (it is) mixed in with steamed milk and espresso? Why, yes. Yes it is. And it's beautiful. Imagine melting down pure Hershey kisses...that's what it's like drinking this thing.
I've been here for a breakfast meeting in the past too. I had a lovely chocolate croissant this one time. Now it's not Pain Quotidien quality...but they heat it up for you AND give you a free piece of their Aroma chocolate. Oh. Yes. That is the stuff there.
My gripe? Don't offer "Free" WiFi(which let's face it, you are purchasing something for that "free" thing) for an hour when you get a good EIGHT MINUTES USAGE. Yes, that's right I COUNTED!!! I don't expect the schmoes behind the counter to be able to help me, except give me another user name and password but by then, I was simply aggravated.
I had to deal with the "S" word that day: "Starbucks," and I was none too happy. But I like Aroma, I like their establishment, I like their products. But I know that if I want to get out of the house and do some writing or job searches, it won't be here. Pity. You would have gotten some business from me.

This place looks like a Greek Diner and an Urban Burger King adopted a Coffee Shop and it has just begun growing into a young adult coffee shop. Not sure, Manhattan needs you as there just aren't enough coffee shop internet places with tons of space (this place has TONS!)
That being said I've been here for 2 hours, sipping on a delicious iced coffee, cruising the internet, catching up on Yelp Reviews and Fantasy Baseball, and done so without hassle to get up and buy something or move along.
The coffee has been very satisfying (would have liked to seen if it was fair trade or not), the internet is strong even outside.
They have a Vegan Portobello Sandwich with Vegan Pesto, which is exciting.
3 Stars for space, outside seating, internet, good coffee, and at least one vegan option. -2 stars for odd decor and fast food feel.
